intro: Gyaladenia congoensis, commonly known as the Congo lily, is a rare flowering plant native to the Democratic Republic of the Congo. It belongs to the family Orchidaceae, which includes orchids, and is characterized by its showy, often fragrant blooms. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forest understories, where it thrives in the humid climate. Its leaves are broad and glossy, and it produces intricate flowers with specialized structures for pollination. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, it is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
